title: hardhat-etherscan: Cannot verify on Avalanche testnet via snowtrace
body:
### Issue

Contract verification on snowtrace via Avalanche Fuji Testnet fails

### Steps to reproduce

1. Deploy a contract to avalanche fuji testnet (`chainId: 43113`, `url: 'https://api.avax-test.network/ext/bc/C/rpc'`)
2. Retrieve an API key from https://snowtrace.io/myapikey 
3. Try to verify the contract using `npx hardhat verify --network avaFujiNetworkId`
4. Find that `Error in plugin @nomiclabs/hardhat-etherscan: Invalid API Key`

Might be a similar issue that was found in https://github.com/rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify/issues/124

This issue is also being [tracked on Linear](https://linear.app/nomic-foundation/issue/HH-563/hardhat-etherscan-cannot-verify-on-avalanche-testnet-via-snowtrace).

We use Linear to manage our development process, but we keep the conversations on Github.

LINEAR-ID: 98a7b16e-8254-4d7c-bb3e-2430ef3e892f
Same issue on my side
So how are we going to fix this? Anyone's got an idea?

> So how are we going to fix this? Anyone's got an idea?

It might be related to the chain id of the sub network being `1`, which might be confused with eth mainnet as per > rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify#124

This issue was API key problem
My partner said working well, So I tried with his API key, and It works well.
Only My key is not working(still says invalid API key)
So I am recommended you need to create new one and try to do it again.

Hm any idea where to get working api keys ?

I generated two from snowtrace.io and both did not work.

So I verified the following:

The network is properly detected by id 

```
CHAIN ID is 43113
chain config {
  "chainId": 43113,
  "urls": {
    "apiURL": "https://api-testnet.snowtrace.io/api",
    "browserURL": "https://testnet.snowtrace.io/"
  }
}
```


And the verification request includes the proper api key

```
{
  "apikey": "MY API KEY",
  "module": "contract",
  "action": "verifysourcecode",
  "contractaddress": "0xVALID_ADDRESS",
  "sourceCode": "{\"language\":\"Solidity\",\"sources\":{\"contracts/...

```
I also tried to create a new account at snowtrace, but the api keys generated there also were deemed invalid

Sent a mail to snowtrace support.
Also read the docs at https://testnet.snowtrace.io/apis#contracts and (unsurprisingly), the POST request from hardhat-etherscan is set up properly.

Nit find: there is a typo in the official api for `constructorArguement` ;)
Same issue here. I verified that the API keys work on the mainnet side, but on testnet side they don't work and there's no separate registration page for testnet (or at least I don't find one)
Thanks for sharing that mainnet avalanche works (that reduces some stress for me haha)
Any update on this issue?

> Thanks for sharing that mainnet avalanche works (that reduces some stress for me haha)

I don't fully understand who is to "blame" here, is it snowtrace that didn't adapt their API correctly for testnet users or is it the plugin that isn't working ?

> Any update on this issue?

Have you tried using truffle or only hardhat ?
Any update here at all? Or has anyone found a workaround? Encountering this exact same issue now.

Hi, 

> > So how are we going to fix this? Anyone's got an idea?
> 
> It might be related to the chain id of the sub network being `1`, which might be confused with eth mainnet as per > [rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify#124](https://github.com/rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify/issues/124)

dropped in exploring this. Avax runs unequal networkId and chainId.   and the documentation and supporting stack overflows very few are salient on this difference (many chains these are equal)
![avax-net](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104736484/171514330-4630c97a-05d5-4d71-8efe-43cacb1725be.png)

It doesn't see that this issue is quite salient in hardhat either 
![no-exist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104736484/171514486-523b70b1-69ef-415f-9c98-7f4fee7c6a66.png)
![no-network-id-option](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104736484/171514562-b0e6adea-013e-49ce-8e3c-bcd4da37eabc.png)

> Hi,
> 
> > > So how are we going to fix this? Anyone's got an idea?
> > 
> > 
> > It might be related to the chain id of the sub network being `1`, which might be confused with eth mainnet as per > [rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify#124](https://github.com/rkalis/truffle-plugin-verify/issues/124)
> 
> dropped in exploring this. Avax runs unequal networkId and chainId. and the documentation and supporting stack overflows very few are salient on this difference (many chains these are equal) ![avax-net](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104736484/171514330-4630c97a-05d5-4d71-8efe-43cacb1725be.png)
> 
> It doesn't see that this issue is quite salient in hardhat either ![no-exist](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104736484/171514486-523b70b1-69ef-415f-9c98-7f4fee7c6a66.png) ![no-network-id-option](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/104736484/171514562-b0e6adea-013e-49ce-8e3c-bcd4da37eabc.png)

Honestly don't even know if this is fixable, you can try flattening your contracts and using snowtrace verify instead. Personally stopped trying, I know it works on the mainnet and that's all that really matters in the end.

Can someone confirm that this is still a problem? The etherscan team has confirmed that there are no issues on their side, and I don't see how this could be a problem on Hardhat side, so I guess it was a temporary issue with the API.
@fvictorio it still doesn't work on Fuji Testnet. API Key is correct
confirming that this is still an issue on fuji.  @fvictorio
